content.question: Which of the following is the Maclaurin series for the function <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> defined by <math alttext="f of x, equals, 1 plus x squared, plus cosine x " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="2 plus the fraction with numerator x squared, and denominator 2, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator x to the fourth power, and denominator 24, end fraction, plus dot dot dot" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>24</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mo>⋯</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="2 plus the fraction with numerator 3 times x squared, and denominator 2, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator x to the fourth power, and denominator 24, end fraction, plus dot dot dot" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>24</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mo>⋯</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="1 plus x, plus x squared, minus the fraction with numerator x cubed, and denominator 6, end fraction, plus dot dot dot" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mo>⋯</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="2 plus x, plus the fraction with numerator 3 times x squared, and denominator 2, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator x cubed, and denominator 6, end fraction, plus dot dot dot" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mo>⋯</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="2 plus the fraction with numerator x squared, and denominator 2, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator x to the fourth power, and denominator 24, end fraction, plus dot dot dot" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>24</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mo>⋯</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 10.14: (BC ONLY) Finding Taylor or Maclaurin Series for a Function

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Identify a re-expression of mathematical information presented in a given representation
